enWisdom: The most difficult of administrative policies is the removal of habits [and customs]

Wisdom: أَسْوَأُ النَّاسِ حَالًا مَنِ انْقَطَعَتْ مَادَّتُهُ وَبَقِيَتْ عَادَتُهُ
enWisdom: The person in the worst condition is one whose material wealth is cut off but his habit [of spending] remains

Wisdom: بِغَلَبَةِ الْعَادَاتِ الْوُصُولُ إِلَى أَشْرَفِ [شَرَفِ‏] الْمَقَامَاتِ
enWisdom: Through overpowering [evil] habits, there is attainment of lofty stations
Change your habits and acts of worship will become easier for you [to perform]

Wisdom: كُلُّ شَيْ‏ءٍ يُسْتَطَاعُ إِلَّا نَقْلُ الطِّبَاعِ
enWisdom: Everything is possible except [changing and] transferring of natural dispositions [of character and personality]
Habit has authority over every human being
